infodynamics.measures.discrete
Class ActiveInformationCalculator

java.lang.Object
  infodynamics.measures.discrete.ActiveInformationCalculator

public class ActiveInformationCalculator
extends java.lang.Object

Usage: 1. Continuous accumulation of observations: Call: a. initialise() b. addObservations() several times over c. computeLocalFromPreviousObservations() 2. Standalone: Call: localActiveInformation()

Author:
Joseph Lizier

initialise

public void initialise()
Initialise calculator, preparing to take observation sets in Should be called prior to any of the addObservations() methods. You can reinitialise without needing to create a new object.

addObservations

public void addObservations(int[] states)
Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs.

Parameters:
states - time series of agent states

addObservations

public void addObservations(int[][] states)
Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs. This call suitable only for homogeneous agents, as all agents will contribute to single pdfs.

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd index is agent number

addObservations

public void addObservations(int[][][] states)
Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs. This call suitable only for homogeneous agents, as all agents will contribute to single pdfs.

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd and 3rd index give the 2D agent number

addObservations

public void addObservations(int[][] states,
                            int col)
Add observations for a single agent of the multi-agent system to our estimates of the pdfs. This call should be made as opposed to addObservations(int states[][]) for computing active info for heterogeneous agents.

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd index is agent number

addObservations

public void addObservations(int[][][] states,
                            int agentIndex1,
                            int agentIndex2)
Add observations for a single agent of the multi-agent system to our estimates of the pdfs. This call should be made as opposed to addObservations(int states[][]) for computing active info for heterogeneous agents.

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd and 3rd index give the 2D agent number

                             int col)

states - - 2D array of states
col - - column number of the agent in the states array
